revised_title: Anatomy and Variations of the Human Sacrum
tldr: The author examines 265 adult sacra and numerous fetal vertebral columns to study the human sacrum's form, anomalies, correlation to other vertebral regions, relation to the spinal nervous system, and ossification. The research reveals a tendency for the first sacral vertebra to be liberated from the sacrum and a greater responsibility for the first sacral vertebra in supporting the ilium. The study also highlights inherent variability in the sacrum's position and a greater tendency towards elongation than contraction of the vertebral column.
